docs.snippet: Donald Trump doesn’t quite make the cut....
docs.lead_paragraph: Donald Trump doesn’t quite make the cut.
docs.abstract: Loose Ends column by author Teddy Wayne describes how he has long supported narcissistic sociopaths for public office, but notes even he cannot in good conscience support Donald Trump, describing him as utter fraud.

docs.snippet: Free trade talks between the European Union and the United States have failed, Germany's economy minister said Sunday, citing a lack of progress on any of the major sections of the long-running negotiations....
docs.lead_paragraph: Free trade talks between the European Union and the United States have failed, Germany's economy minister said Sunday, citing a lack of progress on any of the major sections of the long-running negotiations.

headline.main: German Economy Minister Says EU-US Trade Talks Have Failed
headline.print_headline: German Economy Minister Says EU-US Trade Talks Have Failed

docs.snippet: The alt-right finds a host body in Donald Trump and Hillary finds easy targets in the Donald and the alt-right....
docs.lead_paragraph: The alt-right finds a host body in Donald Trump and Hillary finds easy targets in the Donald and the alt-right.
docs.abstract: Maureen Dowd Op-Ed column observes Hillary Clinton is facing opponent who manages to self-destruct in every news cycle, making her job that much easier; warns, however, that focus on extremists of alt-right movement should not be way for Clinton to get free pass on public scrutiny of her own transgressions.

docs.snippet: The philosophical roots of the Republican candidate’s rhetoric....
docs.lead_paragraph: The philosophical roots of the Republican candidate’s rhetoric.
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by Mark Thompson, chief executive of The New York Times, details how Donald Trump's anti-rhetorical speaking style is form of rhetoric itself, with long history in politics; holds that wile quality to which every anti-rhetorician aspires is authenticity, there is major difference between proclaiming authenticity and actually being true to genuine truthfulness and to facts.

headline.main: Trump and the Dark History of Straight Talk
headline.print_headline: The Dark History of Straight Talk

docs.snippet: The party’s convention gave voice to the religious principle of love as the root of liberal policies, a linking of policy and faith usually associated with the Republican Party....
docs.lead_paragraph: The party’s convention gave voice to the religious principle of love as the root of liberal policies, a linking of policy and faith usually associated with the Republican Party.
docs.abstract: Samuel G Freedman On Religion column argues Hillary Clinton campaign's explicit invocation of concepts like love, hope and mercy signals effort by Democratic Party to regain support of religious voters; asserts party is taking advantage of opening left by Donald J Trump's polarizing campaign.

headline.main: For Hillary Clinton and Democrats, a Public Shift Toward ‘God-Talk’
headline.print_headline: Democrats Shift to Embrace the Religious Left

docs.snippet: How two of his least celebrated accomplishments shaped the battle between Clinton and Trump....
docs.lead_paragraph: How two of his least celebrated accomplishments shaped the battle between Clinton and Trump.
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by essayist Kevin Baker underscores how Johnson Amendment of 1954, banning overt political activities by tax-exempt institutions like churches, and revision of immigration laws, two of Pres Lyndon Johnson's least remembered accomplishments, have already played important role in 2016 presidential election; likens Hillary Clinton to Johnson, but observes that even Johnson's accomplishments for civil rights during his presidency did not come without support, and effort, of American people.

docs.snippet: With little more than two months until Election Day, three of the top five spots on the hardcover nonfiction list are occupied by anti-Clinton books....
docs.lead_paragraph: With little more than two months until Election Day, three of the top five spots on the hardcover nonfiction list are occupied by anti-Clinton books.

docs.snippet: The death of the August vacation for psychotherapists underlines the cultural decline of the therapeutic profession in the life of New York....
docs.lead_paragraph: The death of the August vacation for psychotherapists underlines the cultural decline of the therapeutic profession in the life of New York.
docs.abstract: Ginia Bellafante Big City column investigates whether psychoanalysts still take off entire month of August, ritual dating back to its developer Sigmund Freud that leaves patients on their own for lengthy period of time every summer.

headline.main: A Rite of August Shrinks Away for Some New Yorkers

docs.snippet: Republicans and Democrats sparred Sunday over whether Hillary Clinton crossed ethical lines during her tenure as secretary of state by talking with people outside the government who had contributed to her family's philanthropy foundation....
docs.lead_paragraph: Republicans and Democrats sparred Sunday over whether Hillary Clinton crossed ethical lines during her tenure as secretary of state by talking with people outside the government who had contributed to her family's philanthropy foundation.

headline.main: Politicos Spar Over Ethics Surrounding Clinton Foundation
headline.print_headline: Politicos Spar Over Ethics Surrounding Clinton Foundation

docs.snippet: "Don't Breathe," a twisty story of a group of teenage delinquents who pick the wrong house to burglarize, dominated the late summer box office, debuting to a potent $26.1 million and topping charts. It joins a long list of recent horror films such...
docs.lead_paragraph: "Don't Breathe," a twisty story of a group of teenage delinquents who pick the wrong house to burglarize, dominated the late summer box office, debuting to a potent $26.1 million and topping charts. It joins a long list of recent horror films such as "The Purge: Election Year," "The Conjuring 2," "Lights Out," and "The Shallows" that have all found success with audiences. It's a genre that's particularly attractive to studios, because these films don't require much in the way of special effects or star power, making them cheaper to produce than comic book adventures and science-fiction fantasies.

headline.main: Box Office: 'Don't Breathe' Scares Up $26.1 Million as Hot Summer for Horror Continues
headline.print_headline: Box Office: 'Don't Breathe' Scares Up $26.1 Million as Hot Summer for Horror Continues
